article_title: Assessing The Legal Risk Of Unregulated Yoga Therapy
article_text:
Assessing The Legal Risk Of Unregulated Yoga Therapy

Law360, New York (January 5, 2016, 11:10 AM ET) -- With the rise in integrative and holistic medicine, a new branch of yoga has emerged — yoga therapy. While the yoga community can agree that yoga has general therapeutic benefits, some yoga teachers have sought to apply yoga training to the treatment of particular conditions. Health care in the United States is heavily regulated, and medical professions have established discrete scopes of practice. article_metadata.description: Recently, yoga therapy has emerged as a specialized discipline within the yoga and health care communities. However, without an appropriately defined scope of practice and necessary state authorizations, the increasingly popular method of treatment invites enforcement actions for the unlicensed practice of medicine, says Kristi Kung of Pillsbury Winthrop Shaw Pittman LLP.
